p: L. pubescens is reported in the literature as a species commonly found among the wild flora in Middle-Eastern Asia and Mediterranean Africa; it is, indeed, mainly reported as growing in Palestine [ 28], Yemen [ 29, 30, 31], Saudi Arabia [ 32, 33, 34]. For P. incisa subsp. Candolleana, to the best of our knowledge, only one study is reported in the literature, analyzing wild-growing specimens in Egypt [ 35]. However, Pulicaria spp. are reported as widely used in Northern African folk-medicine [ 36]. These species have been chosen for their good availability in the wild, which makes them an exploitable and easy to gather biomass in their native range.
